intro: Viola orientalis, commonly known as the Persian violet, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Violaceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and prefers well-drained, loamy soils. Its flowers bloom in early spring and are often used in traditional medicine. Viola orientalis is also a popular ornamental plant due to its delicate appearance and resilience in cooler climates.
